content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    doc = Markdown.parse(md)
    julia_code_blocks = filter(x -> x isa Markdown.Code && x.language == "julia", doc.content)
    julia_code = map(x -> x.code, julia_code_blocks)
    return join(julia_code, "\n")
end
```

This function uses the Markdown.jl package to parse the markdown document and extract the Julia code blocks. It then joins the extracted code blocks together with a newline character and returns the result as a String.
